text: Hubert Mingarelli (14 January 1956 â€“ 26 January 2020) was a French writer. He was born in Mont-Saint-Martin, Lorraine. He won the Prix Medici in 2003 for his novel Quatre Soldats (Four Soldiers). The English translation of his novel Un repas en hiver (A Meal in Winter) by Sam Taylor was nominated for the Independent Foreign Fiction Prize. On 26 January 2020, Mingarelli died of cancer in Grenoble. He was 64. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in France Category:French novelists
title: Hubert Mingarelli
